title: Why does riot wants adc's to have the possibility of using Sterak ?
body: PD ( which reduces damage ), Maw ( Which reduces magic damage taken PLUS gives you a shield and a strong passive ) , and QSS ( A good item that totally denies CC mages.). Why should adc's also have the option of buying sterak gage too?

Of course they feel it, by building Steraks you give up a Bloodthirster or a second AS/CRIT item or Mercurial/Lord Dom. Why is Steraks the best choice for defense here? It's the only item that gives any sort if AD AND Burst survival. Before Steraks all you saw was Banshee's Veil, you didn't whine then.

Banshee's gave a spellshield and some health and MR. That's it. You could easily pop the spell shield with a cheap spell, which was the counterplay to it. 

Sterak's gives about the same health, damage, and upon taking enough damage, a shield and a damage steroid. They're completely different situations. One an ADC had to completely forego damage to get a little tanky vs a certain class of damage, now an ADC foregoes only a bit of damage for about the same tankiness base stat wise and even more tankiness upon taking damage.
So basically you agree that Banshee's was a bad item to build on an adc because you would completely lose AD on it for the survivability.

It was an item built for the purpose of allowing yourself a safety pass should you get caught out. It's so when you stepped one foot out of your team Sejuani's ult didn't slam into you and end the game right there. 

And it was fair. you traded damage for tanky. Not half damage, not "I get less damage". No. You traded complete damage, and you got tankier. It was fair. And biggest of all, it had counterplay. You could sling a shitty spell and pop it for like 80 mana should the ADC get a little careless. There's no counterplay to Steraks. Insanely low CD, procs on being significantly hurt. At least items like MAw have a nice CD.

ADCs don't deserve to fend for themselves. The class should never have survivability. Ever. It pumps out the highest damage and melts any class in the game given a few seconds. There is a whole class, support, designed around being the ADC's survivability. There's also other teammates who are supposed to peel. That's where peel comes from, the need to defend hyper carries, which late game, tends to be ADCs. So yes, should Talon or Zed be able to jump on an ADC and murder him/her without any chance of fighting back? Absolutely. That's the role of the assassin. It's the support's job, or other member, to prevent that. With Sterak's, you're giving a class survivability that shouldn't have it. They take a small hit to damage but gain so much tankiness it's absurd. Sterak's was the answer to tanks/bruisers complaining they get annihilated upon engage, which they were. They believed increasing base AD would keep it from ADCs as they typically need bonus AD. However, this wasn't the case as the extreme tankiness they get actually outweighs the class's intended stats.

Defensive AP itemisation is almost entirely based on putting a vague mixture of tanky stats on a champion. That helps with surviving ambient burst but not with actual focus, at all. A mage with Deathcap/Morello/Luden's dies about as quickly as a mage with Rylai's/Abyssal/Zhonya's in most situations.

AD defensive itemisation has actually got a variety of defensive passives and actives. Sterak's and Maw are both insane in 1v1 scenarios (easily turning assassins jumping onto caught out ADCs as kills for the ADC) while giving a shocking amount of tankiness in team fights, and Merc Scim pretty much automatically invalidates any attempt a mage can make at killing an ADC before you even get to the point of procing the Maw or Sterak's shield.

You haven't put any thought into the state of defensive itemisation in both stats if you don't realise how massive the gap is between the two.
